melonjs > game

game 

namespace game

game represents your current game, it contains all the objects, tilemap layers, current viewport, collision map, etc...
game is also responsible for updating (each frame) the object status and draw them.

Public Properties

lastUpdate game.js:87 
lastUpdate: DOMHighResTimeStamp

Last time the game update loop was executed.
Use this value to implement frame prediction in drawing events, for creating smooth motion while running game update logic at a lower fps.

mergeGroup game.js:65 
mergeGroup: boolean = true

when true, all objects will be added under the root world container.
When false, a me.Container object will be created for each corresponding groups

sortOn game.js:76 
sortOn: string = "z"

Specify the property to be used when sorting entities. Accepted values : "x", "y", "z"

viewport game.js:46 
viewport: Camera2d

a reference to the current active stage "default" camera

world game.js:55 
world: World

a reference to the game world,
a world is a virtual environment containing all the game objects

Public Methods

getParentContainer(child: Renderable) → {Container}

Returns the parent container of the specified Child in the game world

Type Description

onLevelLoaded game.js:99 
onLevelLoaded() → {}

Fired when a level is fully loaded and all entities instantiated.
Additionnaly the level id will also be passed to the called function.


 // call myFunction () everytime a level is loaded
 me.game.onLevelLoaded = this.myFunction.bind(this);
repaint game.js:159 
repaint() → {}

force the redraw (not update) of all objects

reset game.js:109 
reset() → {}

reset the game Object manager
destroy all current objects

updateFrameRate game.js:128 
updateFrameRate() → {}

Update the renderer framerate using the system config variables.

See:
  • timer.maxfps
  • World.fps
